diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Homozygous/Compound Heterozygous Triadin Mutations Associated with Autosomal Recessive Long QT Syndrome
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Arrhythmogenic Right Ventricular Cardiomyopathy (ARVC), Catecholaminergic Polymorphic Ventricular Tachycardia (CPVT)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of long QT syndrome (LQTS) was supported by whole exome sequencing revealing a homozygous TRDN-encoded triadin frame-shift mutation in a patient presenting with recurrent exertion-induced syncope/cardiac arrest, QTc prolongation, and extensive T-wave inversions in precordial leads. The clinical features were consistent across multiple patients with similar mutations.
